remarks: The kernel of a non-zero scalar product of a functional equals the kernel of the functional.  (Contributed by NM, 28-Dec-2014.)
statement:
ldualkrsc.r $e |- R = ( Scalar ` W ) $.
ldualkrsc.k $e |- K = ( Base ` R ) $.
ldualkrsc.o $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` R ) $.
ldualkrsc.f $e |- F = ( LFnl ` W ) $.
ldualkrsc.l $e |- L = ( LKer ` W ) $.
ldualkrsc.d $e |- D = ( LDual ` W ) $.
ldualkrsc.s $e |- .x. = ( .s ` D ) $.
ldualkrsc.w $e |- ( ph -> W e. LVec ) $.
ldualkrsc.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. F ) $.
ldualkrsc.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. K ) $.
ldualkrsc.e $e |- ( ph -> X =/= .0. ) $.
ldualkrsc $p |- ( ph -> ( L ` ( X .x. G ) ) = ( L ` G ) ) $.
